content: weft coaster designed by caitlin phillips ravelry oilandchalk instagram @oilandchalk email oilandchalkknits@gmail com pattern notes a perfect project for using up some scrap yarn this coaster is densely knitted in linen stitch creating a firm flat fabric with a woven appearance the small needle paired with dk weight yarn is a little tougher to work than on a larger needle but the payoff is worth it the tight gauge creates a very dense non-stretch fabric that provides excellent heat and water protection for your surfaces yarn needles & gauge dk weight yarn 1 5 us / 2 5 mm needles uses approximately 10 g per coaster 31 stitches cast on on this needle size should measure approximately 3 5 inches / use up dk weight scrap yarn 9 cm abbreviations k knit * * repeat this section p purl ws wrong side s1wyif slip one with yarn in front rs right side s1wyib slip one with yarn in back note all slipped stitches are slipped purl-wise instructions using long tail cast on cast on 31 stitches turn work so that you are holding the needle with cast on stitches in your left hand with working yarn at the right this will become the wrong side of your work row 1 ws *s1wyib p1* repeat until 1 stitch remaining s1wyib then turn work to right side and move yarn to back row 2 rs *k1 s1wyif* repeat until 1 stitch remaining k1 turn work repeat row 1 and 2 until work measures 3 5 inches / 9 cm finishing on a wrong side row turn work to right side and bind-off traditional firm bind off method weave in any loose ends if you weave vertically underneath the visible purl bumps the ends will be super secure and practically invisible enjoy a hot cuppa on your new coaster
